item.title: By: Sarah
item.dc:creator: Sarah
item.description: My son loves owls so this cake will surely surprise him today for his 9th birthday! Thanks so much for the great idea!!

item.title: By: Sara
item.dc:creator: Sara
item.description: Thank you for this one! My daughter is turning 5 tomorrow and I am making this cake for the second year in a row. She just adores it! Thank you thank you thank you. You have made me such a hero. Can't wait to see her smile again tomorrow when she sees it!
item.content:encoded: Thank you for this one! My daughter is turning 5 tomorrow and I am making this cake for the second year in a row. She just adores it! Thank you thank you thank you. You have made me such a hero. Can’t wait to see her smile again tomorrow when she sees it!

item.title: By: Nicole G.
item.dc:creator: Nicole G.
item.description: I used the basis of this idea and it worked well. I made a template but I cut it differently and I was able to utilize all pieces and I had a branch under the feet.
item.content:encoded: I used the basis of this idea and it worked well. I made a template but I cut it differently and I was able to utilize all pieces and I had a branch under the feet.

item.title: By: Laureen
item.dc:creator: Laureen
item.description: THANK YOU! This was fantastic. Your instructions were awesome and I was able to save the day and make my son an owl cake for his 8th birthday. Thankful there are people like you on the web!
item.content:encoded: THANK YOU! This was fantastic. Your instructions were awesome and I was able to save the day and make my son an owl cake for his 8th birthday. Thankful there are people like you on the web!

item.title: By: kiran
item.dc:creator: kiran
item.description:
Wow! This cake is simply adorable and exactly what I want to make for my daughter's first birthday! Thank you for sharing! Do you have any tips on how you actually iced the eyes and tummy? Its so perfectly done and looks so neat. Did you use specific tools?
Thank you!! :)
item.content:encoded:
Wow! This cake is simply adorable and exactly what I want to make for my daughter’s first birthday! Thank you for sharing!
Do you have any tips on how you actually iced the eyes and tummy? Its so perfectly done and looks so neat. Did you use specific tools?

Thank you!! ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Night Owl Pajama Party! | Frozen Coke Fridays
item.dc:creator: Night Owl Pajama Party! | Frozen Coke Fridays

item.title: By: Emily
item.dc:creator: Emily
item.description:
I know you wrote this a while ago, but thanks so much for posting it! I used your basic design (but without the feet) to create a cake for my daughter's owl-themed first-birthday party and it turned out great!! :)
Here is a link to it on my blog so that you can see a picture: http://itsmombojumbo.blogspot.com/2013/04/pearls-first-birthday-bash-recap.html
item.content:encoded:
I know you wrote this a while ago, but thanks so much for posting it! I used your basic design (but without the feet) to create a cake for my daughter’s owl-themed first-birthday party and it turned out great!! ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Elizabeth
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth
item.description:
i wanted to say a big thankyou for your tutorial, i made one for my nans 80th, she doesnt like icing, but loves butter cream so this was ideal. she has had a lifelong love for owls and was so pleased with her cake!!!
wish i could upload a pic for you!
thanks again :) xxx
item.content:encoded:
i wanted to say a big thankyou for your tutorial, i made one for my nans 80th, she doesnt like icing, but loves butter cream so this was ideal. she has had a lifelong love for owls and was so pleased with her cake!!!

wish i could upload a pic for you!

thanks again ðŸ™‚ xxx

item.title: By: Alana
item.dc:creator: Alana
item.description:
Hi Anita,
Love this cake so much, am going to try it out for my daughter's first birthday. Am a bit of a novice at these things but what type of icing do you use for this? Butter cream icing?
Fingers crossed mine will looks something similar to yours!
Thank you for the fab cake idea! x
item.content:encoded:
Hi Anita,

Fingers crossed mine will looks something similar to yours!
